question.title: When is ANTLR skip applied?
question.body:
Does ANTLR wait to find the longest string that matches a token that should be skipped or it skips it as soon as it matches that token?

Suppose we have two tokens in our grammar like this:

TEST:
    [\n][\t | '    ']'|'
    ;
WS
    : [ \t\r\n]+ -> skip
    ;

and the input is like this:


    |

i expected it to be matched by TEST token but it seems like that the first part is matched by WS and then it's skipped so the output says

token recognition error at: '| '

can you explain this and What should i do to be able to catch TEST token in my input?
